intro: Cyrtandra wailauensis, commonly known as the Wailauensis heliotrope, is a flowering plant native to Hawaii. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas within tropical rainforests. It has heart-shaped leaves and produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
